Blue_Shield_of_CA_93228:
below for specific devices considered medically necessary) MAY be considered 
medically necessary as a diagnostic aid for suspected arrhythmias or for evaluation of

III. A resting electrocardiogram (ECG) has not established a diagnosis

V. Standard monitoring techniques such as 24-hour ambulatory electrocardiogram (Holter 
monitor) or an event monitor are inadequate or cannot be used due to the frequency of

VI. The individual has had a non-diagnostic 24-hour Holter monitor or event monitor study

X. Is prescribed following STANDARD Procedure.
XI. Must no be used with any other device

T - Standard monitoring techniques inadequate
N - Non-diagnostic Holter monitor or event monitor study
C - Conform to AEM Heartlist
V - Professionally reviewed by a cardiologist
R - Prescribed following Standard procedure
O - No other device used

P AND (S OR A OR F OR T OR N OR C OR V OR R OR O)

Blue_Shield_of_CA_77385:
Let's denote the variables and criteria as follows: 

- A: Left-sided breast cancer
- B: Prior breast-conserving surgery
- C1: Significant cardiac radiation exposure cannot be avoided using alternative radiotherapy
- C2: IMRT dosimetry demonstrates significantly reduces cardiac target volume radiation exposure
- C2a: With 3D-CRT, V25 ≥ 10 cm^3 
- C2b: With IMRT, reduction in absolute heart volume receiving 25 Gy by at least 20%
- D: Contraindication to hypofractionation
- E: Individual has large breasts (>500 cc)
- F: 3-dimensional conformal radiotherapy dosimetry results in hot spots
- G: Hot spots can be avoided with IMRT
- H: Radiotherapy is being given with curative intent for lung cancer
- I: 3-D conformal radiotherapy will expose greater than 35% of normal lung tissue to more than a 20 Gy dose-volume
- J: IMRT dosimetry demonstrates a reduction in the V20 to at least 10% below the V20 achieved with the 3-dimensional plan
- K: Target volume is in close proximity to critical structures that must be protected
- L1: Planned 3D-CRT exposure to critical adjacent structures is above normal tissue constraints
- L2: Planned IMRT exposure to critical adjacent structures does not exceed normal tissue constraints
- M: The same or immediately adjacent area has been previously irradiated and abutting portals must be established with high precision

Using logical operators and variables, the algebraic expression for the medically necessary criteria would be:

(A AND B AND (C1 AND C2 AND (C2a AND C2b))) OR (D) OR (E AND F AND G) OR (H AND I AND J) OR ((K AND L1) OR L2 OR M)

This expression represents all the necessary criteria for the policy to be applicable.

J = Persistent pain, swelling, itching, burning, or other symptoms associated with saphenous reflux, and interfere with activities of daily living
K = Conservative management including compression therapy for at least 6 weeks has not improved symptoms

Then the algebraic expression for all medically necessary criteria for saphenous vein treatment to be applicable is:
(A OR B OR C OR D OR E) AND (F) AND ((G) OR (H) OR (I) OR (J AND K))

This expression represents that at least one procedure must be used (A, B, C, D, or E), there must be demonstrated saphenous reflux and CEAP class C2 or greater (F), and there must be documentation of at least one of the specified conditions (G, H, I, or symptoms associated with saphenous reflux interfering with daily activities and not improved with conservative management).

Blue_Shield_of_CA_36483:
Let's define the following variables:

- A: Documentation to use only one of the following procedures (not combined use of different procedures or an unlisted procedure)
- B: Demonstrated saphenous reflux and CEAP class C2 or greater
- C1: Ulceration secondary to venous stasis
- C2: Recurrent superficial thrombophlebitis
- C3: Hemorrhage or recurrent bleeding episodes from a ruptured superficial varicosity
- C4: Persistent pain, swelling, itching, burning, or other symptoms associated with saphenous reflux, and both symptoms a. interferes with activities of daily living and b. conservative management has not improved symptoms
- IV: Sclerotherapy techniques as the primary treatment of great, small, or accessory saphenous veins is considered investigational
- V: Stab avulsion, hook phlebectomy, or transilluminated powered phlebectomy of perforator, great, small, or accessory saphenous veins are considered investigational
- VI: Tributary varicosity treatment when performed either at the same time or following prior treatment as saphenous vein treatment may be considered medically necessary
- VII: Use of microfoam sclerotherapy or cyanoacrylate to treat symptomatic varicose tributaries is considered investigational when done separately from saphenous vein treatment
- VIII: Treatment of isolated tributary veins without prior or concurrent treatment of saphenous veins, isolated treatment of symptomatic varicose tributaries using any other techniques, and endovenous radiofrequency or laser ablation of tributary veins are considered investigational
- IX: Perforator vein treatments for leg ulcers may be considered medically necessary under certain conditions
- X: Stab avulsion, hook phlebectomy, transilluminated powered phlebectomy of perforator veins are considered investigational
- XI: Treatment of telangiectasia less than 3 millimeters in diameter are considered investigational
- XII: Mechanochemical ablation (MOCA) of any vein and endovenous cryoablation of any vein are considered investigational

Now we can write the algebraic expression using logical operators:
I. A AND B AND (C1 OR C2 OR C3 OR C4)
II. NOT(A AND B AND (C1 OR C2 OR C3 OR C4))
III. NOT((A AND B) OR (A AND C1) OR (B AND C1))
IV. IV
V. V
VI. A AND (B AND C AND D AND E)
VII. NOT((A AND B) OR (A AND C) OR (B AND C))
VIII. NOT((A AND B) OR (A AND C) OR (A AND D) OR (B AND C) OR (B AND D) OR (C AND D))
IX. A AND B AND C AND D
X. X
XI. NOT(less than 3 millimeters in diameter)
XII. (A AND B) OR (A AND C)

These expressions represent the medically necessary criteria for policy applicability according to the provided policy statement.
